author: Karoun Demirjian
description: A panel came off an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 midair last year in an incident that was nearly disastrous but for the heroics of the crew, according to government investigators.
title: Missing Bolts and Other Failures Caused Plane Panel to Blow Off, N.T.S.B. Says

author: Hilary Howard
description: Climate change is increasingly making weather extremes more common.
title: A Heat Wave Hits New York Earlier Than Usual for a Second Year in a Row

author: Penelope Green
description: A conceptual artist, she used photography to make surrealistic images and then went on to document Manhattan’s downtown scene and its mostly male provocateurs.
title: Marcia Resnick, Whose Camera Captured New York’s ‘Bad Boys’, Dies at 74

author: Alex Williams
description: A former Broadway actress, she was a no-nonsense foil for the unruly Fred Sanford. She also warmed hearts with a recurring role on the “The Waltons.”
title: Lynn Hamilton, a Steady Presence on ‘Sanford and Son,’ Dies at 95

author: Mark Walker
description: A group of male youths traveled to Atlanta before dawn and tore flags at a rainbow crosswalk, the police said. Two of them remain at large as the authorities consider hate crime charges.
title: Pride Flags Slashed at Atlanta L.G.B.T.Q. Landmark, Four Arrested

author: Chris Hippensteel, Mark Bonamo, Sydney Cromwell, Emily Cataneo, Darren Sands and Hawes Spencer
description: A brutally hot day across the Eastern United States left residents struggling to find relief.
title: How People Are Coping With the East Coast Heat Spike

author: Julie Bosman
description: Mr. Pritzker, a Democrat and billionaire hotel heir, has emerged as a vocal critic of President Trump and a possible presidential contender.
title: JB Pritzker to Seek Third Term as Illinois Governor

author: Catie Edmondson
description: Both President Trump and Senate Republican leaders are pressing for the House to accept their version of the sprawling domestic policy bill, but some right-wing holdouts are opposed to key pieces.
title: House Conservatives Warn They Can’t Back Senate Bill to Enact Trump’s Agenda

author: Jack Healy
description: Senator Mike Lee hoped to sell millions of acres of federal land through President Trump’s policy bill, in part to ease housing costs. The opposition was bipartisan, in Congress and the West.
title: A Colorado County Shows Why Mike Lee’s Plan to Sell Public Land Failed

author: Michael Wilson
description: Mr. Weiner returned from a prison term to launch an unlikely campaign for the City Council. Outside a polling place on Tuesday, it was hot, mostly friendly and a little awkward.
title: Anthony Weiner Hopes Voters Have Forgiven or Forgotten

author: Thomas L. Friedman
description: Everyone went all the way in the Israel-Iran conflict, bursting through psychological and military barriers we never imagined would be breached.
title: If This Mideast War Is Over, Get Ready for Some Interesting Politics

author: Chloe W. Shakin
description: The “We Do Not Care” club, founded by influencer Melani Sanders, celebrates women who have stopped trying to please everyone.
title: Women in Menopause Don’t Care

author: Adam Nossiter
description: A Texas Republican, he gave up his seat after news broke that public funds had been used to settle the case, made by his former communications director.
title: Blake Farenthold, 63, Congressman Who Quit in Harassment Case, Dies

author: Julian E. Barnes, Helene Cooper, Eric Schmitt, Ronen Bergman, Maggie Haberman and Jonathan Swan
description: Classified findings indicate that the attack sealed off the entrances to two facilities but did not collapse their underground buildings.
title: Strike Set Back Iran’s Nuclear Program by Only a Few Months, U.S. Report Says

author: Julia Jacobs
description: The government concluded its case after 28 days of testimony in the federal sex-trafficking and racketeering trial. Defense attorneys are expected to be more brief.
title: Prosecution Rests as Sean Combs Trial Nears End

author: Anita Gates
description: First on TV and then on the pop charts, he became so popular so young, he once said, that he “didn’t really have time to have an ego.”
title: Bobby Sherman, Easygoing Teen Idol of the 1960s and ’70s, Dies at 81

author: Johnny Diaz
description: Just before Jake Rosencranz, 29, of Denver, was struck while standing in ankle-deep water in New Smyrna Beach, two people were struck at a golf course in the area.
title: Man on His Honeymoon Is Struck by Lightning and Killed on Florida Beach

author: Joe Rennison
description: A second day of declining oil prices helped lift stocks. Energy costs are a primary expense for companies, making them an important factor in inflation calculations.
title: Stocks Rise and Oil Falls as Middle East Cease-Fire Begins

author: Judson Jones
description: New York’s official temperature gauge hit 99 degrees on Tuesday afternoon. It could climb even higher.
title: Central Park Hits Its Hottest Temperature Since 2012

author: Greg Jaffe
description: The U.S. crews involved in attacking the nuclear site at Fordo probably trained for years. But dropping 30,000-pound bombs was almost certainly a new feeling.
title: How B-2 Bombers Can Fly to Iran and Back

author: Michael Gold
description: The second-term congressman and former mayor of Long Beach, Calif., prevailed over an older and more experienced member to take on the high-profile job on one of the House’s most contentious panels.
title: Democrats Elect Robert Garcia for Top Oversight Post in House

author: Dean Chang
description: Voters are heading to the polls amid sweltering heat. Will New Yorkers know the Democratic mayoral nominee this evening? Unlikely.
title: It’s Primary Day, and the Mayor’s Race Has Never Been Closer

author: Tiffany Hsu
description: The U.S. is dismantling key communications efforts abroad, once a major part of its efforts to build soft power. Its rivals are eager to fill the vacuum.
title: America’s Adversaries Are Gaining the Global Megaphone

author: Sheryl Gay Stolberg
description: The Senate health committee chairman said new members of a key advisory panel who were appointed by Robert F. Kennedy Jr. “lack experience.”
title: Cassidy, in Break With RFK Jr., Calls for Vaccine Meeting Delay

author: Adam Liptak and Mattathias Schwartz
description: After the justices let the administration deport migrants to countries with which they had no connection, a federal judge blocked the removal of eight men.
title: Returning to Supreme Court, Trump Accuses Judge in Migrant Case of Defiance

author: Claire Brown and Christina Kelso
description: Extreme heat is making air pollution worse, scientists say. And President Trump’s regulatory rollbacks could drive air pollution even higher.
title: Extreme Heat Is Exacerbating Air Pollution, a ‘Double Whammy’ for Health

author: Tyler Pager
description: President Trump is expected to talk about spending commitments from the alliance’s members, while NATO’s secretary general has been eager to avoid diplomatic blowups.
title: Trump Departs for NATO Summit and ‘a New Set of Problems’

author: Benjamin Oreskes
description: In two bitterly contested races in Brooklyn, Democratic candidates have clashed over Gaza, while in Manhattan Anthony Weiner is trying to return to the Council.
title: Here Are 5 Key City Council Races to Watch in the N.Y.C. Primary

author: Ligaya Mishan
description: In her first review as our new critic, Ligaya Mishan checks out the View, the revolving Times Square dining room with a nostalgic menu and a stunning panorama of the city.
title: The Times’s New Critic Reviews the View, the Revolving Times Square Restaurant

author: Devlin Barrett
description: Emil Bove III, a Trump judicial nominee, voiced his intent to disobey court orders as others stonewalled and misled judges, according to a complaint.
title: Justice Dept. Leader Suggested Violating Court Orders, Whistle-Blower Says

author: Colby Smith
description: The Fed chair will tell lawmakers that the central bank can wait to see how President Trump’s tariffs affect the economy before lowering borrowing costs.
title: Powell Reiterates Fed’s Wait-and-See Approach Before Cutting Rates

author: Maya King and The New York Times
description: The Democrats running in New York City’s mayoral primary have crisscrossed the five boroughs over several months to make their case to voters in person.
title: 2025 NYC Mayoral Race: Photos From the Campaign Trail

author: German Lopez
description: We explain the state of the cease-fire.
title: Uncertain Peace

author: Michael Simon Johnson, Ian Stewart, Jessica Metzger and Patrick Kingsley
description: Plus, Florida’s new “Alligator Alcatraz” for migrants.
title: A Fragile Cease-Fire Between Iran and Israel, and Toxic Homes in L.A.

author: M. Gessen
description: It may be time to rethink the tragic events in Washington and Boulder.
title: The Story of Antisemitism Needs to Be Rewritten, Starting in New York

author: Michael S. Schmidt and Alan Blinder
description: The university is trying to avoid the appearance of appeasement, something other powerful institutions that made deals with President Trump found impossible.
title: Behind Closed Doors, Harvard Officials Debate a Risky Truce With Trump

author: Glenn Thrush and Alan Feuer
description: Attorney General Pam Bondi has disregarded departmental norms to level lurid public accusations at Mr. Abrego Garcia without first detailing evidence.
title: Judge’s Ruling Casts Doubt on Trump Administration’s Claims Against Migrant

author: Antony J. Blinken
description: Iran can’t be allowed to develop a nuclear weapon, but the president’s approach wasn’t the best way to prevent that.
title: Trump’s Iran Diplomacy Failed. I Hope His Airstrike Succeeds.

author: Simar Bajaj
description: Essential advice to get you through a heat wave.
title: 7 Tips for Managing Extreme Heat

author: Michael Crowley
description: A reactor in Tehran is a monument to the U.S. relationship with Iran when the country was led by a secular, pro-Western monarch.
title: How the United States Helped Create Iran’s Nuclear Program

author: Emily Cochrane
description: Freddie O’Connell, a policy and transit wonk, is under Republican scrutiny for his response to immigration enforcement in his left-leaning city.
title: Freddie O’Connell Confronts the Limits of Political Power in Nashville

author: Tim Wu
description: Instead of asking which future is coming, we should be asking which future we want.
title: A.I. Doesn’t Have to Mean a ‘White-Collar Blood Bath’ of Job Loss

author: Yola Mzizi
description: A large trove of the princess’ belongings including her Lady Dior handbag, will be auctioned this week. For some buyers, more intimate items are the main draw.
title: A Trove Of Princess Diana’s Personal Belongings Is Going Up For Auction

author: Alissa Zhu
description: Patients of PHA Healthcare, a treatment program in Baltimore, were housed in drug-ridden buildings where many overdosed, an investigation reported last year. Some are still there.
title: Maryland Closed a Baltimore Addiction Program. For Some Patients, Little Has Changed.

author: Lisa Miller
description: E.R. doctors want you to know that they are people, too. At an event called Airway, one confessed, “I do not like these big, high stakes, bloody, messy, risky procedures.”
title: Real Doctors of New York Spill Their Guts

author: Patricia Ononiwu Kaishian
description: I celebrate Pride month by going for a walk because nature is exuberantly queer.
title: I Celebrate Pride by Reveling in the Queerness of Nature

author: Maya King and Jeffery C. Mays
description: A winner on Tuesday night is unlikely, but not impossible. Ranked-choice voting will play a big role in the outcome. Here’s what else you should look for as votes are counted.
title: Here’s How the N.Y.C. Mayoral Results May Emerge

author: Trish Bendix
description: The “Tonight Show” host said it was crazy that the president had “launched an attack on Iran, his own parade and a cellphone in the same week.”
title: Jimmy Fallon Wonders What Trump Will Launch Next

author: Michael Kimmage
description: The loss is a tragedy for Russia.
title: Putin Has Lost the West. This Was Not the Plan.

author: Mark Walker
description: Federal prosecutors say the money was used to fly on a private jet, buy real estate and help operate a brewery.
title: Florida Men Accused of Stealing More Than $100 Million Meant for People With Special Needs

author: Christopher Maag and Vincent Alban
description: Whatever the temperature is in Central Park, it’s hotter alongside Newtown Creek, the toxic and industrial waterway separating Brooklyn from Queens.
title: Scenes From the Hottest Blocks in New York City

author: Stephanie Saul
description: The same judge issued an order last week blocking a separate government effort to keep the school from enrolling students from abroad.
title: Judge Blocks Trump Proclamation Barring Harvard’s International Students

author: Lisa Friedman
description: Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said the Clinton-era rule barring road construction and logging was outdated and “absurd.”
title: Trump Administration to End Protections for 58 Million Acres of National Forests
